Description: Weight: half-fals weight of 17 qīrāṭ. Seven lines of Kufic inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: ʿUbaydāllāh b. al-Ḥabḥāb is the only official known to have issued half-fals weights with his name on them. As well as the 17- qīrāṭ variety he issued one of 15 qīrāṭ. Anonymous types with niṣf fals in the legend are the common one of 9 qīrāṭ (1883,0621.32 and 1890,0804.25) and another of 18 qīrāṭ (Balog 1976, 825). Bibliography: Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (36)
